Keys.Name: ShowCurrentAppearanceAfterCloseInventory
Keys.Description: Display the current outfit status (social type and appropriateness) as a HUD message when closing the inventory window.

Keys.Name: Nudity
Keys.Description: If enabled, characters without any clothing will be described as "nude". If disabled, they will be described as "wearing only underwear".

Keys.Name: ClothingUpdateFrequency
Keys.Description: How often (in seconds) the system reevaluates the player's outfit. A value of 0 means only updates after changing the equipment.

Keys.Name: EnableDressCommentsBeforeTalk
Keys.Description: If enabled, NPCs may comment on the player's clothing and deny conversation before dialogue begins.

Keys.Name: IgnoreQuestCharacters
Keys.Description: If enabled, quest-related NPCs won't be affected by this system.

Keys.Name: EnableAmbientContextText
Keys.Description: Enable ambient context messages regarding character's outfit.

Keys.Name: AmbientContextTextFrequency
Keys.Description: Defines the minimum interval between ambient context messages. A value of 0 disables them completely. Lower values allow more frequent messages.

Keys.Name: EnforceDressCodeInSensitiveAreas
Keys.Description: Restricts access to castles, temples, and noble residences unless the player's clothing is appropriate. Shops and taverns are more permissive, but nudity is always denied.

Keys.Name: EnableDressCodeCrime
Keys.Description: If enabled, being indecent in a restricted area may trigger a legal response after a short grace period.

Keys.Name: CrimeGracePeriod
Keys.Description: Defines how many seconds the player has to dress before guards intervene. Only applies when "Enable Dress Code Crime" is active.

Keys.Name: AffectFactionReputationByDress
Keys.Description: If enabled, refusing to dress appropriately will decrease reputation with certain factions (temples, nobles, merchants, etc.).
